summary:
Government is the group of people in charge of a community, usually a country. It consists of three main parts: the legislature (lawmakers), executive (leader), and judiciary (judges). Their job is to make and enforce laws and policies. Many governments follow a constitution, which outlines their principles.

There are different types of governments, like democracies, totalitarian regimes, and authoritarian regimes. Some countries have monarchs as leaders. Historically, there were various forms, such as monarchy, aristocracy, and democracy. Governments can also be a mix of these systems. The key question is how power is gained, either through elections or inheritance.
title: Government
